dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2090 IH: Identifying Potential Terrorist at the Border Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Williams of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend section 236A of the Immigration and Nationality Act with respect to the requirement to cross reference the terrorist screening database.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Identifying Potential Terrorist at the Border Act of 2025.

section.header: Requirement to review Federal terrorist screening database
section.text: Section 236A of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1226A) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking the period at the end and insert ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
is on the terrorist screening database.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Requirement To review Federal terrorist screening database
subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection shall take into and maintain custody over an alien until the Commissioner cross references the name of such alien with the terrorist screening database and a result for such cross reference is received by the Commissioner.
In this section, the term terrorist screening database shall have the meaning given such term in section 2101 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002.
